pushA.name: Push A - Compound Focus
pushA.description: Heavy compound movements with lower rep ranges for strength and power development

exercises.notes: Primary compound movement, progressive overload focus
Vertical push compound movement
Triceps isolation to support compound movements
Bodyweight finisher, focus on form and endurance
Posterior deltoid balance and injury prevention

pushA.progressiveOverloadNotes: Focus on 3% volume increase through weight progression on compounds

pushB.name: Push B - Isolation Balance
pushB.description: Higher volume isolation work with moderate rep ranges for hypertrophy and muscle balance

exercises.notes: Upper chest emphasis, compound variation
Triceps and lower chest compound movement
Unilateral strength and core stability
Shoulder mobility and stability work
Explosive power development finisher

pushB.progressiveOverloadNotes: Focus on rep progression and time under tension for isolation movements

pullA.name: Pull A - Vertical Pulling Focus
pullA.description: Vertical pulling emphasis with compound movements for lat development and strength

exercises.notes: Primary vertical pull compound, progressive overload focus
Horizontal pull balance for complete back development
Biceps isolation with strict form focus
Rear deltoid and rhomboid strengthening
Trapezius isolation and postural support

pullA.progressiveOverloadNotes: Focus on adding weight to pull-ups and rows, rep progression for accessories

pullB.name: Pull B - Horizontal Pulling Focus
pullB.description: Horizontal pulling emphasis with higher volume training for muscle balance

exercises.notes: Biceps-emphasized vertical pull variation
Primary horizontal pull with TRX stability challenge
Unilateral pull with core integration
Biceps and brachialis isolation on incline
Unilateral trap and deltoid work

pullB.progressiveOverloadNotes: Focus on time under tension and rep progression for horizontal movements

legsA.name: Legs A - Quad Dominant
legsA.description: Quadriceps-focused movements with compound squat patterns for lower body strength

exercises.notes: Primary quad-dominant compound movement
Hip hinge pattern for posterior chain balance
Calf isolation for complete lower leg development
Power and conditioning with hip hinge pattern
Core stability to support compound movements

legsA.progressiveOverloadNotes: Progressive loading on squats and deadlifts, volume progression for accessories

legsB.name: Legs B - Hip Dominant
legsB.description: Hip-dominant movements emphasizing glutes and hamstrings with unilateral work

exercises.notes: Primary hip hinge movement targeting hamstrings
Glute isolation and hip extension strength
Unilateral quad and glute development
Explosive hip extension and conditioning
Core strength with hip flexor integration

legsB.progressiveOverloadNotes: Focus on range of motion and control, progressive loading on deadlift patterns

suggested.name: Suggested Workouts
suggested.description: Exercise science-based templates designed for balanced muscle development and progressive overload

expert.name: Expert Workouts
expert.description: Battle-tested workout templates with proven compound/isolation balance and A/B variation system

custom.name: Custom Workouts
custom.description: User-created workout templates saved from the workout builder

designPrinciples: Push A focuses on compound movements with lower rep ranges (4-8 reps)
Push B emphasizes isolation work with moderate rep ranges (8-15 reps)
Pull A emphasizes vertical pulling for lat development (4-8 reps)
Pull B emphasizes horizontal pulling with volume training (6-12 reps)
Legs A focuses on quad-dominant movements (6-10 reps)
Legs B focuses on hip-dominant movements with unilateral work (8-20 reps)
Progressive overload follows 3% volume increase rule from Development Guide
Exercise selection based on scientific muscle engagement data
Rest periods optimized for rep ranges and exercise type
Equipment flexibility for different user setups

scientificBasis.compoundMovements: 4-8 reps for strength and neural adaptation
scientificBasis.isolationMovements: 8-15 reps for hypertrophy and metabolic stress
scientificBasis.restPeriods: Longer for compounds (180-240s), shorter for isolation (90-120s)
scientificBasis.muscleRecovery: 48-72 hour rest between Push A and Push B sessions

integrationNotes.equipmentFiltering: Templates can be filtered by available equipment
integrationNotes.muscleVolumeVisualization: Exercise selection triggers real-time muscle engagement display
integrationNotes.progressiveOverload: Each exercise includes target progression guidelines
integrationNotes.dataStructure: Designed for future FastAPI + Supabase integration per Development Guide
